\begin{frontmatter}{}


\title{Predecessor problem on smooth distributions}


\author[mff,ui]{Vladimír Čunát\fnref{fn1}}


\ead{vcunat@gmail.com}


\ead[url]{http://vcunat.matfyz.cz}


\fntext[fn1]{This research was supported by the Czech Science Foundation under
grant GA14-10799S and by SVV project number 260~104. }


\address[mff]{Faculty of Mathematics and Physics, Charles University in Prague,
Czech Republic }


\address[ui]{Institute of Computer Science, The Czech Academy of Sciences}
\begin{abstract}
We follow a research thread studying the predecessor problem on ``smooth''
distribution families. We propose a conceptually simpler solution
utilizing well-known results from much better studied variant of the
problem that assumes nothing about the input. As a side effect, we
are able to extend the range of handled input distributions for the
most studied case needing expected $\OO\left(\log\log n\right)$ time,
and we provide better insight into why the related methods are faster
on smooth inputs.\end{abstract}
\begin{keyword}
data structures \sep computational complexity \sep search tree
\end{keyword}

\end{frontmatter}{}
